tasks.title: gRPC Protocol Buffer Definitions
tasks.description: Create protobuf definitions for financial accounting service API following ADR-0004 Event Schema Evolution Strategy
tasks.details:
Following ADR-0004 Event Schema Evolution Strategy (PR #23 merged), implement protobuf definitions using manual schema definition approach with buf tooling for validation:

1. Manual Event Schema Definition:
   - Create api/proto/events/financial_accounting/v1/events.proto
   - Define event messages following BIAN patterns: FinancialBookingLogInitiated, FinancialBookingLogClosed, LedgerPostingCaptured
   - Include standard event metadata (event_id, occurred_at, correlation_id, causation_id)
   - Use common types from meridian/common/v1/types.proto for consistency
   - Follow protobuf v3 syntax with proper package declarations and imports

2. Manual gRPC Service Definition:
   - Create api/proto/financial_accounting/v1/financial_accounting.proto
   - Define FinancialAccountingService with RPCs: InitiateFinancialBookingLog, UpdateFinancialBookingLog, ControlFinancialBookingLog, RetrieveFinancialBookingLog, CaptureLedgerPosting, RetrieveLedgerPosting
   - Request/response messages using common types from meridian/common/v1/
   - Include field validation using buf.build/bufbuild/protovalidate
   - Error handling with meridian/common/v1/error.proto

3. Buf Tooling Integration:
   - Use existing buf.gen.yaml configuration to compile protobuf files
   - Run 'buf generate' to create Go code with paths=source_relative
   - Use 'buf lint' for schema validation and style compliance
   - Use 'buf breaking --against main' in CI/CD for compatibility validation
   - Generated Go files placed in api/proto/ subdirectories matching protobuf package structure

4. Event Evolution Strategy:
   - Pattern 1: Add optional fields to existing messages (validated by buf breaking)
   - Pattern 2: New BIAN behavior qualifiers = new event types
   - One topic per event type: financial-booking-log-initiated, ledger-posting-captured
   - No Schema Registry - buf breaking provides compile-time validation
   - 7-day retention policy for internal coordination events

This approach aligns with ADR-0004's decision to use protobuf native versioning without Schema Registry, focusing on compile-time validation and BIAN-aligned semantic event types.
